IT IS THE CONTRACTOR'S RESPONSIBILITY TO ENSURE THAT ALL CONSTRUCTION CONFORMS TO THE REQUIREMENTS OF THE ONTARIO BUILDING CODE. NOTATIONS MADE ON THESE DRAWINGS ARE FOR YOUR INFORMATION AND ASSISTANCE ONLY AND DO NOT NECESSARILY COMMENT ON ALL AREAS OF CONSTRUCTION.
THE FINAL GRADING OF THIS PROPERTY SHALL NOT ADVERSELY EFFECT THE DRAINAGE OF ADJACENT PROPERTIES OR THE OVERALL GRADING CONTROL PLAN.
THE ONTARIO BUILDING CODE REQUIRES THAT A COPY OF THE DRAWINGS AND SPECIFICATIONS THAT HAVE BEEN REVIEWED BY OUR DEPARTMENT BE KEPT AT THE CONSTRUCTION SITE AT ALL TIMES.

images.summary: This site plan for 790 Glassgow St. outlines the property boundaries, landscaping, and building footprint. Key components include a concrete pad, grass areas, and natural vegetation. The plan emphasizes compliance with the Ontario Building Code and notes that the final grading should not adversely affect adjacent properties. Dimensions such as '219'-7 7/8"' and '348'-10 1/2"' define the property lines. The plan includes a 2-storey brick house and a 2-storey addition. Important notes highlight the contractor's responsibility to conform to building codes and maintain reviewed drawings on-site.

images.summary: This detail plan illustrates the accessible ensuite layout, focusing on accessibility features. It includes an 8'-0" finished space with a 5'-0" turning circle for wheelchair maneuverability. The plan specifies a 42" wall with a 1/2" tempered glass partition from wall to ceiling. Key features include slip-resistant flooring, a maximum 1/2" beveled threshold, and various grab bars for safety. A hinged seat is designed to support 1.3 kN, and a pressure-equalizing or thermostatic mixing valve is positioned at 44" AFF. The plan also includes millwork designed for wheelchair access, with a hanging countertop at 34" AFF. The detailed dimensions and specifications ensure compliance with accessibility standards.

The plan includes notes such as 'ROOM NOT PERMITTED TO BE USED AS BEDROOM OR SLEEPING AREA' and instructions to 'UPGRADE ELECTRICAL SERVICE AND PANEL'. Typical ledger board bolt fasteners and post details are specified, including '1/2" x 5" Sleeve Anchor' and '4" x 4" POST FOR DECKS > 6'-0" ABOVE GRADE'. The plan is essential for understanding the basement's configuration and structural support.

The elevation includes asphalt shingles on the roof, typical fascia and soffit, and smooth cement board siding in black. The building features multiple windows labeled as W5, W7, W8, W14, W17, W19, and W20. The first floor includes PT. 4X4 knee braces, and the basement floor has a typical exposed concrete sandblast finish. The elevation also shows a wrap beam with pre-finished aluminum and a cast-in-place concrete step with a handrail. The text annotations provide details such as 'ASPHALT SHINGLE', 'TYPICAL FASCIA AND SOFFIT', and 'SMOOTH CEMENT BOARD SIDING (BLACK)'. The elevation is part of a renovation project, ensuring the existing masonry finish remains in place.

These notes ensure adherence to legal and safety standards during the renovation project.

Each window type is specified with dimensions and quantities. W9 is a casement window with a total width of 5'-1" and height of 3'-2", divided into two sections of 2'-6 1/2" each, with a quantity of 1. W10 is similar but slightly wider at 5'-3", with sections of 2'-7 1/2" each, also with a quantity of 1. W12 is a double casement window with the same dimensions as W9 but taller at 4'-1", with a quantity of 1. It is divided into three sections: two outer sections measuring 1'-11 13/16" each and a middle section of 1'-11 5/16". The section includes a 4 Season Sunroom, Playroom, Kitchen, Bathroom, Hall, Bedroom 1, Closet, and Entry. The insulation is specified as a minimum R50 polyurethane foam, indicating high thermal resistance. The section spans multiple levels, including the first floor, second floor, and basement floor. The drawing is part of project number 22-2300, drawn by L. Ainsworth in October 2024, with a scale of 1/4" = 1'-0".

The pier is designed to bear on undisturbed native soil or compacted fill, as approved by a geotechnical engineer. An isolation slip joint is provided between the perimeter of the pier and adjacent poured concrete slab, if applicable. The post base is specified as an approved Simpson post base. images.summary: This wall section detail shows a steel beam supported by stud framing. The beam is secured with 1/2" bolts spaced at 24" on center, with plates matching the beam flange width. Pre-engineered roof trusses are attached using truss uplift clips. The section specifies bolt requirements for various beam sizes, ranging from W8 to W24. Sub-framing below the steel beam accommodates typical stud sizes, and full-height studs are used per plan. An angle connection with a hooked anchor into concrete is detailed, and posts are secured with wood lag screws. This detail is crucial for understanding the structural assembly of the wall and roof system.

images.summary: This North wall section detail provides a comprehensive view of the structural and insulation components from the basement to the first floor. It includes a rafter baffle, roof underlayment, and drip edge for moisture control. The wall is insulated with R50 polyurethane foam, and windows are wrapped with Blueskin for additional protection. The section specifies a solid wood sill and black window flashing. The basement includes a typical foundation wall with interior and exterior weeping tiles for drainage. This detail is essential for understanding the thermal and moisture management of the north wall.

images.summary: This plan view shows the truss placement for the roof, with dimensions of 35'9" by 25'10". The trusses are labeled as J01, J02, J03, J04, J05, and G01, with additional framing elements labeled A01 through A06. The plan specifies a spacing of 2' between certain elements, with a smaller spacing of 1'10" at one end. A note emphasizes the requirement to provide P.Eng approved truss drawings and specifications to the building inspector at the framing inspection. This layout is critical for ensuring proper load distribution and structural integrity of the roof system.

images.text_verbatim:
Truss Placement Plan
Job Number - 258931-2
790 glassgow
Kitchener ON
Disclaimer
Alpine Systems Corporation (Truss Engineer of Record) Scope of work: The truss plan has been reviewed to verify that the design loads, bearing locations, and/or truss-to-truss load transfers specified on the individual truss designs are appropriate with location, orientation, spacing, and supported framing (if any) indicated on the truss placement plan. Conventional framing members (sizes and connections) and any other elements or components (non-truss items) have not been included in this review. No site inspection will be made by Alpine Systems. Loading was specified by others to be verified by the Project Engineer or the Authority Having Jurisdiction prior to fabrication. Truss conforms to NBCC2020, BCBC 2024, NBC-2023 Alberta Edition, 2024 MBC, and OBC 2024. Review applies to the above project, and only to the trusses referenced on the index sheet.
Truss Fabricator Scope of Work: Fabrication of trusses according to the individual truss designs as derived from the building plans as approved for span, spacing, quantities, and truss profile.
Project Engineer and Truss Installer Scope of Work: All roof and/or floor truss bracing (overall building bracing) if not specifically designed by the Project Engineer shall conform to generally accepted empirical guidelines of "BCSI – Building Component Safety Information".
Scope of Work
When signed and sealed, the scope of work of Alpine Systems Corporation is limited to the design of individual metal plate connected wood truss components based on the loading, spacing, geometry and bearing locations shown on this drawing.
The overall building design and project design specifications, non-truss component design, truss support, bearing or anchorage design, truss permanent bracing design and anchorage, truss fabrication review, and truss site installation review are specifically outside of Alpine’s scope of work.
images.summary: This section contains detailed notes regarding the truss placement plan for the roof. It includes the job number 258931-2 and location at 790 Glasgow, Kitchener ON. The disclaimer by Alpine Systems Corporation outlines their scope of work, which involves reviewing truss designs for appropriate loads, bearing locations, and truss-to-truss load transfers. The truss designs conform to various building codes such as NBCC2020 and OBC 2024. The truss fabricator is responsible for fabricating trusses according to approved designs, while the project engineer and installer must ensure truss bracing conforms to BCSI guidelines. Alpine Systems' scope is limited to designing individual truss components, excluding overall building design and non-truss components. This information is crucial for ensuring compliance with safety standards and proper installation of the truss system.
